item.title: Apache Redirect for http to https via .htaccess
item.description: Generic way to do it but would result into duplicate URLs, e.g. https://example.com & https://www.example.com 1RewriteCond %{HTTPS} off 2RewriteCond %{HTTP:X-Forwarded-Proto} !https 3RewriteRule ^(.*)$ https://%{HTTP_HOST}%{REQUEST_URI} [L,R=301] To avoid the duplicate URLs, do the following: 1## 1. Redirect all non-https except www to https://www 2RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} !foo\.example\.com [NC] # exclude foo.example.com domain 3RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} !bar\.example\.net [NC] # exclude foo.example.net domain 4RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} . 5RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} !^www\. [NC] 6RewriteCond %{HTTP:X-Forwarded-Proto} !https 7RewriteRule ^ https://www.
